Title: Data Analyst
Description:
If you’re looking for a career where you can make a real impression, join Global Service Center (GSC) HSBC and discover how valued you’ll be.

HSBC is one of the largest banking and financial services organizations in the world, with operations in 64 countries and territories. We aim to be where the growth is, enabling businesses to thrive and economies to prosper, and, ultimately, helping people to fulfil their hopes and realize their ambitions.

We are currently seeking an experienced professional to join our team in the role of Analyst Operations Analytics




Role purpose:

This position provides support and analytical expertise to deliver commercially relevant Global Collections, Underwriting, Credit Bureau and fraud standards that build functional operational capabilities to deliver results. Will provide support across a spectrum of capabilities, including Analytics, UWS, Collections Operations, Credit Bureau, Fraud Operations, Change Management and Systems.




Principal accountabilities:

The role holder is responsible for supporting Regional Operations Analytics in support of ensuring strong and sophisticated operations capabilities, aligned to Group standards of expectation.
Individuals will support Operations actions, priorities, and performance to deliver improved execution of operations, through the development and delivery of customer-centric, sustainable relationship capabilities.
Conduct/Create complex research projects and/or statistical models related to project design, data collection, analysis, and summary of findings, recommendations, and presentation of results.
Gather and analyses economic, industry, demographic, and/or other data to determine impact on business operations, as appropriate.
May manage projects to develop recommendations for credit policy, credit/data support systems, bulk acquisitions, new merchant program structures, profitability/pricing for accounts and portfolios and provide revenue, cost, and delinquency and loss forecasts.
Responsible for complete project lifecycle of assigned research projects.
Given a business problem, must be able to create a test plan, collect necessary data to facilitate complex analysis (from various sources using various tools), convert the data into informational, conclusive, and actionable results in a format that can be shared and discussed with senior leaders of the organization.
Ensure operational execution of existing strategies is optimal and compliant with policy.
Evaluate and implement internal and external credit scoring models using both traditional and other advanced predictive technologies. May use segmentation and optimization tools in strategy development.




Skills:

Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, statistics, finance, economics, engineering or related field or equivalent experience; master’s degree preferred.
Strong management, interpersonal, organizational, analytical, problem-solving, project management and verbal and written communication skills.
Proficiency with personal computers as well as pertinent mainframe systems and statistical software packages, preferably R, Python or SAS.




Experience:

Requires advanced knowledge of business practices, business methods and business systems utilized to ensure data is interpreted properly.
3 years proven credit policy and/or credit risk management/analytics experience, or equivalent. Strong knowledge and understanding of financial services preferred.
Requires advanced data manipulation and programming skills.




Due to the urgent hiring need, candidates with immediate right to work locally and no relocation need will be prioritized.

At HSBC we offer our colleagues a greater number of days, so that they can fully enjoy their wedding, take care of the new member of the family, or grieve the loss of a family member. Our paid leave package is at the forefront in Mexico, now you have one more reason to be HSBC and proudly live a culture of well-being, balance and care.

HSBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and, opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. We encourage applications from all suitably qualified persons irrespective of, but not limited to, their gender or genetic information, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, social status, medical care leave requirements, political affiliation, people with disabilities, color, national origin, veteran status, etc., We consider all applications based on merit and suitability to the role.

Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website.




***Issued By HSBC Electronic Data Process Mexico Private LTD***

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My client is seeking a remote Data Analyst II to join our team. You'll collaborate with our attorneys to support employment law cases, including pay equity, workforce reductions, and wage & hour issues.




Key Responsibilities:

Data Preparation: Gather and organize client data for analysis.
Data Analysis: Apply statistical methods to analyze data accurately and appropriately.
Reporting: Summarize and present findings clearly for non-technical audiences.
Security: Adhere to data security protocols and ensure quality control.

Qualifications:

Proficiency in STATA or similar statistical software.
Experience with statistical methods like probit, logistic regression, and conditional logit.
Ability to manage and integrate complex datasets.
Strong communication skills to explain complex ideas simply.
Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s preferred.
At least 2 years of relevant experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Team

Arta Finance is a dynamic fintech startup committed to revolutionizing the financial landscape. We leverage cutting-edge technology and innovative solutions to provide seamless financial services. As we embark on a journey of growth and expansion, we are seeking a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our team and contribute to our success.

The Role

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join Arta. As the first Data Analyst to be hired at Arta, you will play a crucial role in extracting insights from data, contributing to data-driven decision-making processes, and supporting the overall success of our fintech products. You will report to the Head of Finance.

What You Will Do


Data Analysis:
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in financial datasets.
Assist in creating reports and dashboards for key stakeholders to facilitate decision-making.
Conduct statistical analysis to derive meaningful insights and support business objectives.
Collaboration:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product development and marketing, to understand data requirements and provide analytical support.
Data Visualization:
Create visually compelling charts and graphs to effectively communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Who You Are


Bachelor's degree in a relevant field.
Minimum 1 year of relevant work experience.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages such as SQL or Python
Familiarity with data visualization tools, such as Tableau
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and understandable manner.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
You must be based in the Bay area and have work authorization in the US.
You will be expected to work at our Mountain View office at least 3 times per week.


What We Offer


We have a robust health insurance offering for you and your family
High deductible health plan available with health savings account contribution
20 weeks of parental leave
15 days paid time off annually and end of year shutdown
Up to $75 per month reimbursement for internet
$100 per month for wellness stipend


Arta's Compensation Philosophy

We determine your level based on factors including your interview performance, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Our offers are based on salary bands that are updated periodically using market benchmarks and consider geographic location as well (for example, higher cost regions like San Francisco or New York). If you are presented with an offer, we will review the base salary, benefits, number of options, notional option value and strike price. We would like to know if you accept our offer within 7 days.

Please keep in mind that the equity portion of your offer is not included in these numbers and represents a significant part of your total compensation.

IC I: $110,000-$180,000

IC II: $160,000-$230,000

IC III: $180,000-$300,000
Show more
HTML:
The Team

Arta Finance is a dynamic fintech startup committed to revolutionizing the financial landscape. We leverage cutting-edge technology and innovative solutions to provide seamless financial services. As we embark on a journey of growth and expansion, we are seeking a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our team and contribute to our success.

The Role

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join Arta. As the first Data Analyst to be hired at Arta, you will play a crucial role in extracting insights from data, contributing to data-driven decision-making processes, and supporting the overall success of our fintech products. You will report to the Head of Finance.

What You Will Do

  • Data Analysis:
    • Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in financial datasets.
    • Assist in creating reports and dashboards for key stakeholders to facilitate decision-making.
    • Conduct statistical analysis to derive meaningful insights and support business objectives.
  • Collaboration:
    • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product development and marketing, to understand data requirements and provide analytical support.
  • Data Visualization:
    • Create visually compelling charts and graphs to effectively communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Who You Are

  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field.
  • Minimum 1 year of relevant work experience.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
  • Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages such as SQL or Python
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools, such as Tableau
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and understandable manner.
  • Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • You must be based in the Bay area and have work authorization in the US.
  • You will be expected to work at our Mountain View office at least 3 times per week.

What We Offer

  • We have a robust health insurance offering for you and your family
  • High deductible health plan available with health savings account contribution
  • 20 weeks of parental leave
  • 15 days paid time off annually and end of year shutdown
  • Up to $75 per month reimbursement for internet
  • $100 per month for wellness stipend

Arta's Compensation Philosophy

We determine your level based on factors including your interview performance, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Our offers are based on salary bands that are updated periodically using market benchmarks and consider geographic location as well (for example, higher cost regions like San Francisco or New York). If you are presented with an offer, we will review the base salary, benefits, number of options, notional option value and strike price. We would like to know if you accept our offer within 7 days.

Please keep in mind that the equity portion of your offer is not included in these numbers and represents a significant part of your total compensation.

IC I: $110,000-$180,000

IC II: $160,000-$230,000

IC III: $180,000-$300,000

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Jr. Data Analyst (Pricing Operations)

Great opportunity for a Jr. to Mid Level Data Analyst to join a highly visible team with an industry leader!




We seek a detail oriented, highly organized, and analytical Analyst who excels at process improvement. You will be trained in our software/tools and will be responsible for working closely with business partners in order to execute multiple pricing projects. You will work on various pricing requests and utilize an internal pricing engine to perform data manipulation based on a set of product pricing/discount rules to complete each project. You will identify trends in the data and will communicate findings and make data-driven recommendations.




This is a 6 month contract (potential to extend) in the Vinings area.




This group follows a hybrid model of 4 days/week onsite (Mon-Thurs) & 1 day/week remote (Fri).




REQUIRED SKILLS:

Bachelor's Degree
1-3 years of professional experience as a Data Analyst (Jr. to Associate level)
Advanced Excel skills - VLOOKUPS, Pivot Tables, Formulas, etc.
Proven experience identifying trends/insights in data
Process improvement skills
Detail-oriented, highly organized, & driver personality
Excellent communication & presentation skills




Visionaire Partners offers all full-time W2 contractors a comprehensive benefits package for the contractor, their spouses/domestic partners, and dependents. Options include 401k with up to 4% match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short/long term disability, critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident coverage, and both Medical/Dependent Care FSAs.




W2 ONLY; No 3rd Parties, C2C, or Visa Sponsorship

Title: Data Analyst - LCM
Description:
¡Oye, es hora de que te unas a nosotros para mostrarle al mundo que somos la empresa que está cambiando paradigmas, donde revolucionamos las horas, los minutos y los segundos!

¿Quieres saber por qué Rappi?

⭐️ VEMOS OPORTUNIDADES donde otros ven problemas;

⭐️ VEMOS CERCANIA donde otros ven distancia;

⭐️ VEMOS ADRENALINA donde otros ven presión.

Únete a un equipo donde todos somos capaces de TODO, donde todos tenemos las mismas oportunidades, sin importar género, raza, orientación sexual, religión, nacionalidad, edad, discapacidad, formación o experiencia.

¿Te ha gustado lo que has leído hasta ahora? Descubre cómo entregarás magia junto con nosotros a través de tu misión Rappi 🧡

Revisa Cómo Impactarás Nuestro Ecosistema

Serás un colaborador con competencia en programación estadística, utilizando R o Python. Desempeñarás un papel importante en la realización de experimentos y análisis que influirán en nuestra comprensión y en las estrategias empresariales. Se requiere un conocimiento sólido en metodologías estadísticas avanzadas y habilidad para la resolución de problemas basada en el análisis de datos.

Responsabilidades

Como parte de Rappi, serás responsable de:


Diseñar e implementar experimentos controlados, utilizando metodologías como el Efecto Promedio del Tratamiento (ATE), Tratamiento en los Tratados (ToT), Variables Instrumentales/Efecto Promedio del Tratamiento Local (IV/LATE), y Diferencia en Diferencias (DiD).
Emplear R o Python para un análisis detallado y preciso de datos experimentales, incluyendo la aplicación de modelos de regresión logística, emparejamiento en observables y árboles causales.
Trabajar colaborativamente con analistas senior para interpretar datos, desarrollar nuevos modelos y derivar percepciones accionables.
Abrazar una cultura de aprendizaje y desarrollo para mejorar habilidades en diseño experimental y análisis estadístico.
Contribuir con ideas y enfoques innovadores para abordar desafíos experimentales y mejorar metodologías. Comunicar claramente hallazgos y percepciones impulsadas por datos a miembros del equipo y stakeholders.


Bien y ahora, ¿Cuáles son los requisitos para que yo sea parte de este universo de neón?

Requisitos


Competencia intermedia en R o Python, específicamente para análisis estadístico.
Conocimiento de modelos y métodos estadísticos, incluyendo Efecto Promedio del Tratamiento (ATE), Tratamiento en los Tratados (ToT), Variables Instrumentales/Efecto Promedio del Tratamiento Local (IV/LATE), Diferencia en Diferencias (DiD), y modelos de regresión logística.
Fuertes habilidades analíticas y de resolución de problemas con enfoque en precisión y detalle.
Una actitud proactiva de aprendizaje y la capacidad de aplicar efectivamente nuevos métodos estadísticos.
Buenas habilidades de comunicación para presentar datos complejos de manera comprensible.
Habilidades de trabajo en equipo y un enfoque colaborativo en la resolución de problemas.
Un enfoque orientado al crecimiento, abierto a la retroalimentación y dedicado a la mejora continua.


Tipo Empleador

Regular

Empleador

Tarjetas del Futuro

Para más información consulta nuestra pagina web https://about.rappi.com/es y revisa nuestras reseñas en Glassdoor https://acortar.link/Eqm07Q

¡Te esperamos con mucha ansiedad y brillo en los ojos para entregar magia juntos! #Rappi 🧡

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role & Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst working for Dassault Systèmes, you will utilize your curiosity, analytical savvy and technical expertise to support the North American Business Development Organization. As you grow into your role, you will help design and implement new tools to enhance the data collection and data analysis for the Organization.


Collecting, processing and analyzing large datasets to support business decisions
Developing and maintaining reports, dashboards, and visualizations to provide insights to stakeholders
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data driving continuous improvement
Working closely with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver actionable insights
Ensuring data integrity and accuracy through regular validations and audits


Qualifications:


Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business, Engineering or like discipline
3+ years of experience
Very strong proficiency in Excel
Exposure to tools like NIM, KNIME and data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI
Well-developed analytical and problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal


Compensation for this role will be commensurate with experience. The total expected compensation range will be between $80,000 - $140,000, representing the base salary (or annualized salary based on estimated hourly compensation) and target bonus.

Diversity statement

As a game-changer in sustainable technology and innovation, Dassault Systèmes is striving to build more inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. We believe that our people are our number one asset and we want all employees to feel empowered to bring their whole selves to work every day. It is our goal that our people feel a sense of pride and a passion for belonging. As a company leading change, it’s our responsibility to foster opportunities for all people to participate in a harmonized Workforce of the Future.

Compensation & Benefits

Dassault Systèmes offers an excellent salary with potential for bonus, commensurate with experience. Benefits include a choice of plans providing comprehensive coverage for medical, dental, vision care for employee & dependents as well as employee life, short & long term disability, tuition reimbursement, immediate 401K enrollment, 401K match (50 cents on the dollar, up to the first 8% of your eligible compensation that you contribute based on match eligibility criteria), flexible time off policy, and 10 paid holidays.

Equal opportunity

In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at 3DS are based on merit, qualifications and abilities. 3DS is committed to a policy of non-discrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical or common conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, familial status, national origin, ancestry, age (40 and above), disability, veteran status, military service, application for military service, genetic information, receipt of free medical care, or any other characteristic protected under applicable law. 3DS will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What are the top 3-5 skills, experience or education required for this position:

Experience of SQL coding
Maintenance & execution of trending platform using SQL programming
Review and interpret of ongoing business report requirements
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft excel
Develop procedures and scripts for data mapping for new products




Requirements and Qualifications

Experience of SQL coding.
BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related subject
Excellent understanding of SQL work bench.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel.
Strong knowledge of VBA macro development is also preferred.
Sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on company’s success.
Critical thinker and problem-solving skills.
Team player.
Good time-management skills.
Great interpersonal and communication skills.
3- 5+ years experience




Duties and Responsibilities:

Maintenance & execution of trending platform using SQL programming.
Review and interpret of ongoing business report requirements.
Research required data.
Build appropriate and useful reporting deliverables.
Analyze existing SQL queries for performance improvements.
Suggest new queries.
Develop procedures and scripts for data mapping for new products.
Provide timely scheduled management reporting.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
MDM Analyst -HealthCare




The Senior Analyst, MDM will be a key member of the MDM team and will work to develop and maintain the match strategies using data from various data sources including but not limited to our Credentialing and Human Resource systems.




Principal Duties and Responsibilities:




Standard onboarding activities associated with IS&T and Performance Analytics team, navigating/obtaining access to required applications and tools.
Completion of MDM Training modules for Profisee MDM Tools
Formal review of Business Requirements, Operations Guides, Reference Tables, and program artifacts located on Teams/SharePoint Sites
Review of Outgoing Data Model containing views offered to MDM Consumers and associated data dictionaries to familiarize self with the current state of the MDM Program.
Use of Teams Foundation Server (TFS) for the management of development sprint work, ability to draft tasks for upcoming work
Support Master Data Work queues and ticketing to Business Data Stewards:
Daily review of Provider Records Match Queues to validate proposed/excluded records
Provide support to business/technical team members as an experienced consultant in the payor enrollment and medical staff credentialing data management space




Additionally, the role will also require support in the development of basic business requirements. This includes the following tasks.




Identify tables and fields within systems.
Speak to the business source owners in their industry-accepted terms and conditions.
Develop data definitions.
Define business item requirements for developers to transform, extract, validate, and test data from source systems

MDM Analyst -HealthCare


The Senior Analyst, MDM will be a key member of the MDM team and will work to develop and maintain the match strategies using data from various data sources including but not limited to our Credentialing and Human Resource systems.


Principal Duties and Responsibilities:


  • Standard onboarding activities associated with IS&T and Performance Analytics team, navigating/obtaining access to required applications and tools.
  • Completion of MDM Training modules for Profisee MDM Tools
  • Formal review of Business Requirements, Operations Guides, Reference Tables, and program artifacts located on Teams/SharePoint Sites

  • Use of Teams Foundation Server (TFS) for the management of development sprint work, ability to draft tasks for upcoming work
  • Support Master Data Work queues and ticketing to Business Data Stewards:
  • Daily review of Provider Records Match Queues to validate proposed/excluded records

Additionally, the role will also require support in the development of basic business requirements. This includes the following tasks.

  • Speak to the business source owners in their industry-accepted terms and conditions.
  • Develop data definitions.
  • Define business item requirements for developers to transform, extract, validate, and test data from source systems

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities:


Work with large amounts of data to draw meaningful conclusions
Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
Provide regular reporting and analysis to team
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key metrics and performance indicators
Ability to communicate with customers to analyze historical data and identify KPIs
Ability to design report wireframes, data models, create technical designs based on functional specifications and business requirements
Leverage advanced DOMO functionality (parameters, actions, tooltip modifications, API, etc.) to create analytical dashboards
Ability to communicate with customers to analyze historical data and identify KPIs
Analyze data to identify trends and share insights
Implement Domo dashboards


Qualifications:


Minimum two years of experience with DOMO
MajorDOMO Certification Required
3+ years experience in data analysis, reporting, business intelligence or financial analysis
2 years experience in providing people analytics reporting to organizations
Demonstrated experience using SQL, and DOMO
Deep understanding in relational and non-relational databases and data warehouse
Analyze, evaluate, improve, and document processes and workflows. Identify and take advantage of opportunities for process automation and simplification.
Proven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption
Strong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionality
Strong data management abilities
A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude
Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization
Experience in python, R or Scala is advantage

Description:
IT Data Analyst (W2 Contract) *****Not open to vendors - please do not call about C2C. *****







Candidates should currently live in the Eastern Standard Time Zone to be considered.










Applicants must be US citizens or permanent residents. No sponsorship or c2c is available and it is not open to vendors.
This position is Contract and will have an EST Remote work schedule. The client is not currently open to candidates who do NOT live in EST.
Candidates experienced with SQL, Snowflake, and healthcare environments are preferred.










Data Analyst Qualifications

Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, or similar field
Two to three years of experience working in data analytics field, ideally in healthcare
Proficiency with SQL programming and developing complex queries (required)
Experience designing and building dashboards in Tableau or Power BI (required)
Working knowledge of Python or R (preferred)
Demonstrated analytical and critical thinking skills and desire to solve technical challenges
Be curious and a self-starter who can work independently or as part of a team prioritizing deliverables and meeting deadlines with minimal oversight
Keen attention to detail
Strong command of Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Excellent communications and interpersonal skills (oral and written)
Snowflake experience
Healthcare experience










IT Data Analyst Description

The Data Analyst Contractor will work with the Business Analytics team to help define, measure, and analyze strategic initiatives to advance quality of care, improve operational efficiency, and elevate provider satisfaction through data analysis and visualization. The Data Analyst Contractor will report to the Lead Data Analyst on the Business Analytics team. The role of the Business Analytics team is to collaborate with key stakeholders and business leaders throughout the company across multiple lines of service to define metrics, validate and analyze data, and develop reports to enhance decision-making.










IT Data Analyst Duties

Responsible for data collection and the analysis process to include business rules, data querying, data cleaning, data exploration, and data visualization
Collect, integrate and analyze data from multiple datasets to deliver meaningful insights
Design/Maintain Power BI visualizations and reports for key metrics to identify and monitor initiatives Enhance decision making and improve processes through statistical analysis and data ion
Provide recommendations related to data collection processes and dashboard designs Perform other duties as assigned

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Insight Global is looking for a Data Analyst to support one of our clients in the Charlotte, NC area. This person will be responsible for collaborating and consulting with attorneys and professional staff to build analytical solutions. They will be drawing data for basic reporting in Power BI as well as helping internal stakeholders and clients to provide data analytical expertise and leverage data and reporting tools like Python. Communication, presentation skills and attention to detail is imperative as this person will be working on a collaborative team environment and working quickly on time sensitive projects.




Requirements:

-5+ years of Data Analytics experience

-5+ years of Data Engineer experience

-Highly technical:

-Python

-SQL

-ETL processes / Ad flow

-Soft skills: communication, presentation skills, attention to details

-Data analytics consulting background

-Experience working within a legal industry




Plusses:

-PowerBI experience

-Familiar with cloud technology

-Experience with R language

-AWS + Azure experience

-Knowledge of IT concepts / Linux administration

-SQL server management studio experience

-Statistical modeling

-Bachelor's degree (Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, other Sciences)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Type

Full-time

Description

Paylocity is an award-winning provider of cloud-based HR and payroll software solutions, offering the most complete platform for the modern workforce. The company has become one of the fastest-growing HCM software providers worldwide by offering an intuitive, easy-to-use product suite that helps businesses automate and streamline HR and payroll processes, attract and retain talent, and build a strong workplace culture.

While traditional HR and payroll providers automate basic HR processes such as payroll and benefits administration, Paylocity goes further by developing tools that HR and businesses need to compete for talent and deliver against the expectations of the modern workforce.

We give our employees what they need to succeed, including great benefits and perks! We offer medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and a 401(k) match, as well as perks that support you, your family, and your finances. And if it’s career development you desire, we provide that, too! At Paylocity, people matter most and have always been at the heart of our business.

There are jobs and then there are careers. Since 1997, Paylocity has been hiring talented people, giving them big challenges, and providing the right resources to help them succeed. Our award-winning culture ensures all employees feel truly welcome, appreciated, and free to be themselves. While other companies talk about it, we make it happen. Join Paylocity and launch your career!

Position Overview

The Data Analyst will design, develop and validate reports and metrics to measure business performance across Operations for management purposes.

The Data Analyst is responsible for analyzing operational data to identify performance gaps and unfavorable trends. This role will also help to improve the client experience and operational capability by presenting recommendations for process improvement projects.

Responsibilities


Work collaboratively across functional teams such as Sales, Service, Finance Implementation to drive improvement and own strategic analytics priorities.
Defining, tracking, and analyzing key performance indicators and providing operations reporting and analytics. Provide recommendations based on business knowledge, metrics, and trends to improve overall business health and performance.
Identify and implement process and system improvements through an understanding of data flows and leveraging technology solutions.
Reconcile and ensure consistency of data from various sources and assist in driving the automation of reports and analytics.
Work with the team to develop and maintain complex data visualizations and reporting within PowerBI with multiple data sources.
Maintain and clean data in Salesforce as needed, keeping it free of duplication and inaccuracies.
Create and maintain reports and dashboards in Salesforce and other reporting systems.
Create and maintain data documentation, including data dictionary.
Troubleshoot data-related issues in Salesforce and other business systems.


Requirements


Minimum 2 years’ experience in data analytics
Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science, information systems or equivalent work experience
Strong MS Office skills, especially with Excel, specifically being able to import data and use pivot tables
Understanding of report writing required
Experience working with Power BI and other relational databases
Experience working in CRM & Project Management tools such as Salesforce, Oracle, Monday.com, Netsuite, Zendesk


Preferred Skills


Experience with Salesforce.com and TaskRay
Experience with SQL, and statistical packages (R, SAS, Ste)


Soft Skills


Team Player – will be able to collaborate with others to make awesome happen.
Self-Motivated – you like to work hard, play hard.
Adaptable – quick feet! You can shift priorities if needed.
Highly Organized – detail-oriented is your thing!


Paylocity is an equal-opportunity employer. Paylocity is committed to the full inclusion of all individuals. We recruit, train, compensate, and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable law. At Paylocity, we believe diversity makes us better.

We embrace and encourage our employees’ differences in age, culture, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion or spiritual belief, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other characteristics that make our employees unique. We actively cultivate these differences through our employee resource groups (ERGs), employee experiences, perspectives, talents, and approaches to drive innovation in the software and services we provide our customers.

We comply with federal and state disability laws and make reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. To request reasonable accommodation in the job application or interview process, please contact accessibility@paylocity.com.

This role can be performed from any office in the US. The pay range for this position is $53,343 - $87,551/yr; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. This position is eligible for an annual bonus and restricted stock unit grant based on individual performance in addition to a full range of benefits outlined here. This information is provided per the relevant state and local pay transparency laws for the location in which this position will be performed. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via www.paylocity.com/careers.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is an international Online Video Platform (OVP) provider on a mission to help publishers monetize their own content to maximize revenue through content automation and video recommendations using AI and Machine Learning.

Trusted by some of the leading publishers globally including Nasdaq, Hearst or Vice Media and backed by visionary venture capitals such as Walt Disney Company or 83North, this company has a shared passion for reimagining the video space.

As The First US-based Data Analyst You Will


Work cross-functionally with global Operations, Data, R&D, Finance and other teams
Define and monitor KPIs and analyze large amounts of data by providing actionable insights into all areas of the business
Design, build and maintain insightful and call-to-action dashboards, reports and metrics as well as monitoring and maintaining the integrity of the data
Present findings to key stakeholders in the company
Manage multiple projects and clients in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment


Requirements


6+ years' experience as a Data Analyst or Business Analyst- both quantitative and statistical
Experience with data visualization tools including Tableau and Looker
Business-oriented mindset
High proficiency in SQL and Excel
Experience with A/B testing methodology and evidence of successful business impact through testing
Excellent communication skills to convey complex quantitative analyses clearly and visually appealingly to international audiences to inform decision-making
World-class problem solving skills as well as a can-do mentality, critical mindset and prone to debate in order to reach the best possible outcome


Bonus Points


Previous experience in a high tech company and AdTech in particular
Familiarity with monetization optimization strategies
Knowledge of Python with data analysis capabilities
Experience with Big Data tools: BigQuery, Athena etc


This is a hybrid position with offices in Manhattan and salary goes up to $115,000 p.a. for the right candidate. In addition to that, competitive benefits and great opportunities for career progression are offered.

Does this sound like the right opportunity for you? Click on 'Apply' or get in touch with Ben Sanchez @ Pros2Work. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analysts will be responsible for analyzing and problem solving as its relates to data, types of data, metadata, and relationships among data elements within a business system or IT system. This role interacts with end users and reporting analysts to understand key data entities and data structures in capturing detailed data requirements. They will identify correlations between raw enterprise data and management, so data extraction, analysis and transformations are used as actionable intelligence. Data analysts may receive requests from all members of the Bank including the management team and must have strong task prioritization skills in addition to good statistical and critical thinking skills. Data analysts will often assist in complex modeling to properly present data. Data analysts are responsible for consulting and assisting with project analysis, program design, report writing, scripting, dictionary synchronization, and other technical maters required for computer applications. Data analysts will create models and data sets that adhere to written standards and best practices, and fully test and document to assure expected results. The position requires strong data analysis, problem-solving, business process, time management, reporting skills and knowledge of R, SQL and/or Python.

Essential Functions

A data analyst with some experience is required, who has a strong background in client and team requirements gathering. The post holder will be part of the information strategy team.

Responsibilities will be expected to be developed and finalized over time and will include but will not be restricted to leading and carrying out:


Working under the supervision of the Data Management manager, partner with key business users and stakeholders to define data migration requirements, resolve data issues and validate procedures and results
Identify, document and validate data migration scope, data requirements and system/ infrastructure solutions
Define source system data requirements, data quality issues/fixes and business rules
Map and specify target data requirements and associated data transformations
Test data migration results and validate migration with key users and business analysts
Be a self-starter with solid interpersonal skills - projecting a very positive customer-service-oriented attitude
Adhere to processes and policies
Assist in the creation of dashboards for senior management
Develop automation or efficiencies in production and monitoring reports
Assist in creating and maintaining department procedures
Monitor and analyze the Bank’s business lines and provide reporting to senior management
Create insights from external datasets; market, industry, geographic and economic
Participate and enhance the current method of Bank reporting
Preparation of models for senior management
Ability to become proficient in the Bank’s CRM tool, Salesforce
Assist with document gathering for loan sales, participations and pledged assets
Participate in any current and future department goals
Assist supervisor on any ad hoc requests


JOB QUALIFICATIONS


Experience with mapping source to target systems with large data models
Strong SQL abilities for database query and reporting
Expert in Excel and proficient in other MS Office tools
Ability to understand and work with large quantities of data to identify trends, errors and gaps
Ability to multi-task and manage concurrent projects in various stages of development
Impeccable customer service and interpersonal skills and excellent written and verbal communications skills mandatory
Experience in customer management, contracts, product, pricing, invoicing and commissions preferred
Experience with ERP systems preferred
Experience with agile project management techniques preferred
Experience with data governance, master data management, data warehouse and business intelligence preferred


About Northern Bank & Trust Company

Northern Bank is a full-service bank dedicated to providing practical, common sense financial solutions to help our customers live their lives and grow their businesses. From deposit products to loans to payment and collections services, we work hands-on with our entrepreneurial customers, both locally and across the country, to provide the financial support they need to realize their personal and business goals. Founded in 1960, Northern Bank has assets of over $3 billion with 13 locations serving communities throughout Middlesex County. Northern Bank is a Member of the FDIC, and an Equal Housing Lender. For more information on online banking services, please visit www.NBTC.com or follow Northern Bank on

Powered by JazzHR

Founded in 1960, Northern Bank has assets of over $3 billion with 13 locations serving communities throughout Middlesex County. Northern Bank is a Member of the FDIC, and an Equal Housing Lender. For more information on online banking services, please visit www.NBTC.com or follow Northern Bank on

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
In the journey of life, your career should make a difference.

At Inizio Evoke, we come together—to do the best work, in the best possible place. We’re all in. Because it’s everyone’s role to make health more human™.

Your role as a Data Analyst

The Data Analyst at Inizio Evoke Transformation will play an integral part of supporting and often driving the discovery of insights that can generate actionable change.  As the data analyst you will collect, store, manipulate, query, and utilize essential data for the purpose of advanced analyses. The ideal candidate has strong foundational data analysis skills, exposure to a wide array of different types of analysis, and the ability to translate data into insights in a story-driven narrative. The data analysts is a curious, supportive, and collaborative team player.

 

You Will:


Identify, analyze, and interpret trends and patterns from data sets by using an array of technical/analytical tools such as Python.
Develop a deep understanding of patients, other customers, and market dynamics, and deliver insights that help the organization drive patient impact. 
Apply statistical techniques to uncover innovative recommendations for business operations to integrate recommendations into strategic decision making (such as new ways to evaluate a more efficient system for acquiring sales leads, or predicting revenue outcomes or ticket sales)
Uncover business insights and create data visualizations (including charts, graphs, and tables) to drive and facilitate strategic conversations within all business operations teams.
While driven by your team lead, you will help define clear, impactful business priorities, and develop action plans that will result in an immediate positive impact
Test analytical experiments in a methodical manner, and regularly evaluate alternate models via theoretical approaches representing the likelihood of a range of outcomes.
Assess the effectiveness of promotional efforts, projects, and practices and identify opportunities to optimize value of investments.
Collaborate within cross-functional teams to develop solutions.
Take an enterprise mindset, linking individual responsibilities with broader organization; focus on outcomes that provide most business and patient value.
Act as a thought partner and advisor to all relevant teams and stakeholders


 

You Have:


1-2 years of performance analysis experience (i.e. Campaign Analysis, basic regressions, market mix modelling, segmentation & forecasting) applied within marketing is highly preferred but not necessary, and analysis experiences within pharma/healthcare agency environment is strong plus, but also not essential.
Experience working with Python is required
Demonstrated aptitude in mathematics, basic statistics, analysis, and research
Experience pulling, validating, and cleansing data for analysis from various platforms or exposure to a multitude of different types of datasets (time based, sales based, geographically focused, performance based etc.)
Demonstrated ability to analyze large datasets, often integrating multiple datasets together
Introductory experience with statistical modelling, analysis, and presentation of results to a non-technical audience
Working knowledge of secondary data sources including syndicated sales, promotional and marketing data, longitudinal patient level data, preferred but not essential
Foundational understanding of the scientific methodology and how it applies to data analysis from establishing a hypothesis to prove or disapprove, to data gathering, cleaning, clustering, analysis, visualization and communication around data output


 

Don't meet every job requirement? That's okay! Our company is dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. If you're excited about this role, but your experience doesn't perfectly fit every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right person for this role or others.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Hello professionals

Role: Data Analyst

Location: Boston, Massachusetts (100% onsite)

Required Skills


Past working experience in Investment Operations domain. Should be proficient in at least one


Investment Operations domain (Data management, Trade management, Derivatives, IBOR, Data

Delivery/Reporting)


Familiarity with diverse asset classes (Equity/Fixed Income/FX/Derivatives (Cleared/Bilateral) & security


reference data and account reference data related attributes


Facilitate technology projects from start to finish, including gathering/documenting requirements,

ongoing maintenance.

Perform business analysis activities such as requirements gathering, detailed data analysis, data


mapping and testing while collaborating with business teams.

Additional Skills


Oracle/SQL Skills
Experience with client onboarding projects for Investment Operations outsourcing.
Strong understanding of end-to-end Investment operations workflows and functions is desirable.
Exposure to Eagle and/or Eagle Data integration is a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Delphi-US, LLC - Peacemakers in the Talent War
Description:
Title: Data Analyst/Operations Associate (Contract) - Job#5067




Location: Boston, MA




Job Description:

Our client located in Boston, MA has an immediate opening for a Data Analyst/ Operations Associate to join their team. This resource will have data management systems experience, a command of Excel, and intellectual curiosity. This position requires an individual who is exceedingly detail-oriented and organized who possesses a determination for accuracy and has the ability to navigate complex databases.




Responsibilities

Maintain the integrity of the Raiser’s Edge/NXT database specifically for Opportunities, Actions, and Notes with some monitoring of InfoEd.
Monitor the LOI, Planned, Pending, Awarded, Declined, and Withdrawn Gift and Grant Opportunity records within the Raiser’s Edge/NXT and InfoEd databases for FR and CP teams.
Review all opportunities submitted by officers to ensure accuracy.
Retrieve and document notices of grant agreements and grant contracts; upload to corresponding Opportunity record in NXT database.
Enter, review, monitor, and assess Action records weekly in order to ensure timely response to foundation deadlines and reporting: Send related reminders to FR and CP team members; track past due and upcoming gift/grant reports, distribute to FR and CP team, and update NXT as appropriate.
Working with Prospect Development and Research Team, create pending future Action records for foundations determined viable through prospecting.
Reconcile NXT Opportunity and Gift records with projections on a monthly basis to ensure accuracy of each Pending, Awarded, Declined gift/grant submission.
Actively identify and pursue opportunities to improve FR and CP operations by troubleshooting, resolving issues, and leading data cleanup projects.
Manage, coordinate, and maintain the integrity of filing systems; ensure proposal attachments and other frequently needed data are current, e.g. patient demographics, audited financials, board lists, letters of recommendation, etc.
Anticipate and provide timely response to FR, CP, Operations, and Development requests for information, service, and assistance.
Use Asana gift forms to enter upcoming gifts and grants into NXT record.
Schedule and track payments, future payments, create invoices, pledge reminders, draft acknowledgements, and other stewardship activity and outlined in gift/grant agreements and MOUs.




Required

Bachelor’s degree required
Two years of experience focused on data analytics, process implementation and improvements in a nonprofit or for-profit field
Knowledge of fundraising procedures and processes is preferred
Demonstrated ability to take complex data outputs and synthesize into understandable reports
Familiarity with CRM and CRM-related applications and database operations, preferably with those used in development. Experience with Raiser's Edge, Raiser's Edge NXT, and/or InfoEd preferred
Mastery of Excel, the creation and utilization of pivot tables
Proficient with PowerPoint or the equivalent software
Ability to manage multiple tasks in a deadline-driven environment
Proven track record with attention to detail, precision, multi-tasking, and problem-solving
Strong written communications skills
Superior interpersonal, communication and customer service skills
Discretion in handling sensitive and confidential information




About Delphi-US

Delphi-US is a national recruiting firm based in Newport, Rhode Island. We specialize in IT, Engineering and Professional Staffing services for premier corporations and a multitude of industries across the United States. We are the Peacemakers In The Talent War – bringing the best and brightest talent to Employers of Choice, enabling critical project success, fostering progressive employment relationships, and promoting competitive advantages for our Clients and the Talent Marketplace we serve. Delphi accomplishes this with a proprietary skill-based and cultural matching process that results in higher qualified submissions along with increased interviews and offer rates. You’ll find our team is highly experienced, friendly, professional and ready to advocate on your behalf, armed with industry trends, and an understanding of employer expectations.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

Victory Programs is a Boston-based nonprofit organization dedicated to helping homeless individuals and families who may have substance use disorders, often accompanied by chronic health issues like HIV/AIDS, Hepatitis C, and mental illness. Providing a welcoming environment, our compassionate and inspiring team is committed to helping them regain their health and restore their hope through immediate access to safe and stable housing.

The Data Analyst reports directly to the Senior Director of Impact and Evaluation for support and supervision. The overarching goal of the department is to leverage data to better understand how to grow Victory Program’s impact and reach.

Essential Functions


The Data Analyst is responsible for the following key functions and will lead efforts to streamline and automate these processes:
Scan, tag, and enter data, ensuring the integrity of client records
Curate and distribute a standard set of reports for each program division, in support of quality assurance and program operations
Produce analytics for quality assurance, program operations, and compliance with funder requirements
The data analyst will integrate programmatic data across platforms to produce dashboards (e.g. via Tableau)
Special projects, as assigned

Non-Essential Functions


Participate and support the agency in program events, State House rallies, fundraising and advocacy events, rallies, walks and any additional functions
Perform any other duty or task that may be requested from time to time by your supervisor or their designee


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field of study (e.g. Computer Science, Data Science, or Information Systems) with at least 2 years of practical experience required; Master’s degree preferred
Ability to follow instructions and attention to detail
Process-minded
Proficiency in analytics tools (e.g. Google and Microsoft applications, Python, R, SPSS, ArcGIS); strong working knowledge of SQL is required
Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences
Intellectual curiosity and creativity
Organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
Comfort with change and ability to thrive in an ever-evolving program environment
Ability to work both independently and cooperatively
Availability to work 40 hours onsite per week, during regular business hours
Three professional work references, at least 2 from a supervisor or manager
Fluency in Spanish is a plus


Position Type: Full-time exempt (40 hours) Monday-Friday

Rate: $70,000 Annually

Victory Programs values a diverse workforce, as we collectively seek to create welcoming, inclusive and accessible environments for our employees and the people we serve. We strive to sustain healthy, functioning communities that respect and celebrate different experiences, identities, cultures and ideas.

Victory Programs has helped individuals and families in crisis for 45 years. Thousands turn to us yearly for shelter, sustenance, recovery, care, and professional, compassionate support. Most struggle with homelessness, substance use and mental health, and many live with HIV/AIDS. Our team of more than 250 staff across 21 programs works with people to develop and execute creative, safe solutions to the very real challenges our clients face.

Our benefit program includes a 75% health and 25% dental employer premium contribution, 100% employer paid disability and life insurances, 19 days of earned time in your first year, sick time, personal days, tuition remission, and a retirement savings opportunity

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
This is not a Jr/Entry level role - Fresh graduates please do not apply




W2 only - no 3rd party candidates - inquiries for this role




Duration - 6-12 months Contract to hire

Location - onsite in Andover, MA




Senior Data Analyst (5+ years of experience) - Data Science, Python, SQL, ML, Modeling




Job/Project Details:

• Mine, manipulate, and analyze data from multiple internal and external sources, reporting

key actionable insights using statistical rigor to inform the larger organization of noteworthy

trends that impact the business.

• Develop metrics, and automated dashboards to give visibility into key measures of logistics performance and provide deep dive analyses on their movements.

• Partner with the Product, Finance, Logistics, Clinical, and Tech teams to gather requirements,

create reporting and drive analytics projects that help solve complex logistics challenges.

• Constantly investigate and support implementation of new optimization, AI and ML techniques to provide tactical and strategic solutions to address the evolving Transplant Logistics needs.

• Support the ongoing design of the NOP logistics network topology, estimate resource needs, resource assignments, schedule optimization, and operational cost and efficiency improvements.




Must Haves:

Advanced SQL Skills - 5+ years of hands-on experience
Python
Machine Learning
Regression Modeling




Preferences:

Tableau OR Power BI
Bachelors/master's Preferred

Title: Reporting Analyst, Advanced Analytics
Description:
Ocean Spray is hiring for a(n) Reporting Analyst, Advanced Analytics! We’re a team of farmers, thinkers, creators, and doers. Whatever your title, whatever your role — it always comes back to this: we’re a farmer-owned co-op where everyone rolls up their sleeves to get the job done. Three maverick farmers started it all — and we’ve been making our own way ever since.

Position Location: We're all about flexibility. This will be a remote role based out of our corporate headquarters in Lakeville, MA. We are open to remote candidates.

The Reporting Analyst impacts the future success of Ocean Spray by developing and maintaining reports that address business questions and deliver insights that lead to greater sales and profit. The role requires the ability to work cross functionally with multiple business partners and stakeholders. The ideal candidate will have strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple simultaneous projects and deadlines. The ability to translate multiple complex data sets into clear and concise reporting and dashboards is essential to the role.

They will also assist with the development, integration, and commercialization of learnings across Ocean Spray and functional partners to analyze data, standardize KPIs, develop internal score cards, all while driving best practices.

A Day in the Life...


Update sales, media, innovation, and buyer behavior reporting.
Assist with Sales & Trade spend reporting, data queries, pulls and analyses.
Support the optimization of existing reports inclusive of both front end and back-end improvements as well as support the transition to centralized reporting workspaces.
Help facilitate data driven decision making by providing insights and trends pertinent to the business.
Work to understand key business questions and assist in developing report tracking, KPIs and dashboards to help best manage the business.
The ability to analyze large, complex internal data sources, providing analytic solutions, cross-group guidance, and support training where necessary for interpretation and implementation of results.


Required

What We Are Looking For:


Bachelor’s Degree
1+ years of relevant experience
Understanding of syndicated (e.g. Nielsen, IRI, SPINS) and POS data
Understanding of PowerBI (or other reporting platform) including establishment of data models, applications, reporting, and executive dashboards
Understanding of key financial metrics and their drivers
Strong written and oral communication


Education

Bachelor's or University Degree (Required)

Work Experience

At least 1 Year of Experience

Annual Salary

$57,700 - $79,300

The base salary range information above serves as a guideline of the position’s typical hiring range. We value and appreciate what makes you unique and will consider a variety of factors when determining an offer. These factors include, but are not limited to, your skills and experience, external and internal benchmarks, as well as overall company considerations. Certain positions may be eligible for short-term and long- term incentive rewards. We also offer a competitive and comprehensive benefits program that supports all aspects of your health and well-being.

Benefits


Complete insurance package on Day-1 that includes a plethora of health and wellness programs
Health, Dental and Vision insurance
Health savings account
Flexible spending account
Life and accident insurance
Employee assistance program
Telehealth services
Fertility benefits
Transgender benefits
1:1 health coaching and more
401(k) with up to 6% Company matching; additional potential discretionary match at year-end
Short-Term Incentive/Performance bonuses
Flexible scheduling options
Vacation pay, up to three weeks of time (pro-rated for your first year of employment)
Holiday pay for 12 holidays
Career development and growth opportunities
Tuition/Education assistance programs
Access to LinkedIn Learning
Scholarship programs for children of employees
Parental leave
Bright Horizons Family Solutions – Back-up care, tutoring, etc.
Adoption assistance
Bereavement leave
Up to $300 fitness reimbursement
Up to $300 massage reimbursement
Employee appreciation events
Employee discounts
Charitable giving

Who We Are

You might have our iconic cranberry juice in your fridge or have gotten into heated holiday debate about what’s better - canned or fresh cranberry sauce. But did you know that the hardworking people growing the superfruit in our products are 700 family farmers that own our cooperative? They entrust us with what is most precious to them to create new and innovative products that will delight consumers and grow this beloved brand today and into the future.

Team Members, Farmers, Consumers And Communities Alike--we Value What Makes Us Unique And Strive To Connect Our Farms To Families For a Better Life By Living Our Values


Grower Mindset – We embrace our grower-owners innovative spirit and heritage through confidence, learning and focus on the future.
Sustainable Results – Guided by purpose, we are focused on delivering results for our grower-owners.
Integrity Above All – We are ethical, doing the right thing for our grower-owners, customers, consumers and each other
Inclusive Teamwork – We build diverse and inclusive teams that strengthen our cooperative.


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

$57,700 - $79,300

The base salary range information above serves as a guideline of the position’s typical hiring range. We value and appreciate what makes you unique and will consider a variety of factors when determining an offer. These factors include, but are not limited to, your skills and experience, external and internal benchmarks, as well as overall company considerations. Certain positions may be eligible for short-term and long- term incentive rewards. We also offer a competitive and comprehensive benefits program that supports all aspects of your health and well-being.

Benefits

  • Complete insurance package on Day-1 that includes a plethora of health and wellness programs
    • Health, Dental and Vision insurance
    • Health savings account
    • Flexible spending account
    • Life and accident insurance
    • Employee assistance program
    • Telehealth services
    • Fertility benefits
    • Transgender benefits
    • 1:1 health coaching and more
  • 401(k) with up to 6% Company matching; additional potential discretionary match at year-end
  • Short-Term Incentive/Performance bonuses
  • Flexible scheduling options
  • Vacation pay, up to three weeks of time (pro-rated for your first year of employment)
  • Holiday pay for 12 holidays
  • Career development and growth opportunities
  • Tuition/Education assistance programs
  • Access to LinkedIn Learning
  • Scholarship programs for children of employees
  • Parental leave
  • Bright Horizons Family Solutions – Back-up care, tutoring, etc.
  • Adoption assistance
  • Bereavement leave
  • Up to $300 fitness reimbursement
  • Up to $300 massage reimbursement
  • Employee appreciation events
  • Employee discounts
  • Charitable giving
Who We Are

You might have our iconic cranberry juice in your fridge or have gotten into heated holiday debate about what’s better - canned or fresh cranberry sauce. But did you know that the hardworking people growing the superfruit in our products are 700 family farmers that own our cooperative? They entrust us with what is most precious to them to create new and innovative products that will delight consumers and grow this beloved brand today and into the future.

Team Members, Farmers, Consumers And Communities Alike--we Value What Makes Us Unique And Strive To Connect Our Farms To Families For a Better Life By Living Our Values

  • Grower Mindset – We embrace our grower-owners innovative spirit and heritage through confidence, learning and focus on the future.
  • Sustainable Results – Guided by purpose, we are focused on delivering results for our grower-owners.
  • Integrity Above All – We are ethical, doing the right thing for our grower-owners, customers, consumers and each other
  • Inclusive Teamwork – We build diverse and inclusive teams that strengthen our cooperative.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

Title: Junior Data Analyst – Image Processing
Description:
LifeCanvas Technologies is an MIT spinoff venture aiming to revolutionize the way we see and study biological systems to elevate human health. LifeCanvas offers cutting-edge technologies and end-to-end solutions that enable holistic molecular imaging of biological systems to accelerate the pace of breakthrough discoveries in science and the development of new therapeutic strategies. We are based in Cambridge, MA.




Why is this the right opportunity for you?

LifeCanvas is a fast-growing, well-funded startup with game-changing technologies whose mission is to lead the paradigm shift in 3D spatial molecular mapping to elevate human health. The venture is generating revenue and profit fueled by the rapid adoption of our revolutionary products and services in key markets. Join early and make an immediate impact on building and shaping the future of a company developing novel tools for the improvement of human health. We value the autonomy, responsibility, and well-being of our team members who define the DNA of LifeCanvas. Come join a team that is pushing the boundaries of science and technology to illuminate life in 3D like never before. If you are looking for something more from your job like a bigger problem to solve with immediate and long-term impact and a mission to believe in every day, come join us.

There will be ample opportunities to be promoted to a senior role based on your performance. You will also be working with world-class researchers in both academia and industry on Bioengineering, Drug Discovery, Oncology, and Neuroscience projects across the nation and beyond.







What You Will Be Doing:

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will be part of the data analytics team, focusing on the analysis of 3D fluorescence microscopy images of biological tissues. You will support our internal Contract Research team and collaborate with a global customer base of world-class scientists in bioengineering, neuroscience, and related fields to help them quantify and present their results.




Key Responsibilities:

Assist in the development and implementation of image processing algorithms for 3D fluorescence microscopy images.
Optimize and maintain components of the image analysis pipeline (SmartAnalytics).
Run and troubleshoot analyses for Contract Research data to ensure timely and high-quality completion of projects.
Juggle multiple tasks efficiently while maintaining attention to detail.
Communicate effectively with customers and other teams at LCT to ensure smooth project execution.







Our Ideal Candidate Will Have:

A bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., computer science, biostatistics, electrical engineering, bioengineering, computational biology, or related area) or equivalent experience.
Some experience with image processing for biological/biomedical applications.
Proficiency in Python for data science and image processing (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-image, OpenCV, pandas).
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to optimize code for speed and efficiency.
Strong interest in working in a fast-growing life sciences startup environment.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with customers and cross-functional teams.




Preferred but Not Required:

Familiarity with brain structures and immunohistochemistry.
Familiarity with best practices for software development (version control, file management, organization).




If you are a motivated individual with a passion for analytics and a desire to contribute to cutting-edge research, we encourage you to apply.




Why LifeCanvas Tech?

Medical, dental, & vision insurance
Flexible time off
401k match
Snacks, coffee, and plenty of office lunches

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
RSA Conference™ is the premier series of global events and year-round learning for the cybersecurity community. RSAC is where the security industry converges to discuss current and future concerns and have access to the experts, unbiased content and ideas that help enable individuals and companies advance their cybersecurity posture and build stronger and smarter teams. Both in-person and online, RSAC brings the cybersecurity industry together and empowers the collective “we” to stand against cyberthreats around the world. RSAC is the ultimate marketplace for the latest technologies and hands-on educational opportunities that help industry professionals discover how to make their companies more secure while showcasing the most enterprising, influential and thought-provoking thinkers and leaders in cybersecurity today.

As part of this evolution, we are seeking a proven Marketing Data Analyst that can support the marketing team by providing data driven insights regarding markets, competitors, and campaign effectiveness. Working alongside a Senior Data Strategist and Marketing Director, this role will be responsible for maintaining, enhancing, and executing a comprehensive marketing analytics strategy and tracking program. This position will provide analysis on a formal and ad hoc basis using standardized and automated reporting with the objective of measuring performance and supporting business decisions. Working with the Data Strategist, the Data Analyst will provide analysis and visualization of large data sets.

Responsibilities


Provide business analytics for marketing
Work with stakeholders to understand their unique challenges, translate those challenges into data problems, and then provide insight back to the business based on a quantitative perspective
Summarize analytical results, drawing out key learnings, making recommendations and presenting to key stakeholders in a clear and precise manner
Work with Data Strategist to define data requirements for modelling and automation projects
Work with all-things Google Analytics 4, Google Tag Manager, BigQuery, and Tableau


Skills & Experience


Experience analyzing and visualizing organic/paid search, email, social, online transactions, and website behavior data
Conducting advanced attribution and ROI modeling using campaign data across channels and user journey
Performing clustering/cohort analysis on large datasets for the purpose of identifying market segments and future product initiatives
Writing ad-hoc queries to assist in analysis of customer segmentation and reporting
Assisting in the maintenance and expansion of existing data documentation, including data definition, meta data, sampling, and cleaning procedures
Assisting in the design and creation of data transformation processes prior to visualization and establish convention for post-transformation data storage
Performing analysis and visualization of user survey data indicating correlation, distribution, and deviations
Extensive experience configuring and maintaining a complex Google Analytics 4 implementation
Extensive experience configuring and maintaining a complex Google Tag Manager implementation, including creating a tag firing logic based on user consent
Extensive experience working in Tableau environment and creating interactive visually compelling dashboards
Experience working in Tableau Data Management and Prep Conductor for the purpose of manipulating and setting auto-refresh data pipelines is a plus
Understanding and experience managing data lineage, quality, and governance
Working with a software application used for issue/request tracking and project management (Jira preferred)
Ability to build relationships and work cross functionality
Display excellent interpersonal skills – someone who is a team player and who has the personality, global perspective, and cultural sensitivity to collaborate across RSAC


Advocate for workplace inclusion and social responsibility.  

Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in statistics, business administration, finance, mathematics or a related field
Minimum of 5 years in business analytics including experience in Analytics, Marketing Analytics and strategy development within a B2B environment
Reasoning Ability: Able to make independent judgments which have considerable impacts on the organization. Able to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete


Benefits

RSAC believes in investing in our people. We offer:


Competitive salary, benefits, and perks for all full-time employees
Employer-subsidized medical, dental and vision insurance
401K retirement employer match
Home office equipment stipend and monthly technology stipend
Thirteen paid holidays per calendar year
Unlimited personal time off
Annual employee bonus dependent upon overall company and personal performance
Annual company-wide offsite


Our Culture

We believe that our differences make us stronger, and we are committed to fostering a culture of respect, empathy, and understanding.


We are a fully remote team operating across the United States, giving our employees the flexibility to work from wherever they choose.
Our team is passionate and results-oriented, striving to achieve excellence in everything we do.
We strongly believe in creating an inclusive environment that values diversity and encourages our team members to share their unique perspectives.
We recognize that by collaborating and working together, we can achieve our goals faster and more effectively.


Why RSAC?

The RSAC team takes great pride in helping shape the future of cybersecurity and being part of an expansive global community! We're always looking for imaginative and visionary individuals who share our passion for providing cutting-edge programs that equip cybersecurity practitioners worldwide with the intel and knowledge they need to thrive and safeguard organizations against cyberthreats.

Our Values


Adaptability: In our ever-changing world, we innovate through determination, creativity and resourcefulness.
Community: We bring people together and build trust by embracing the unique thoughts and perspectives of others with kindness and respect.
Excellence: Because we are where the world talks security, we have the highest expectations of ourselves and our partners.

We're always looking for imaginative and visionary individuals who share our passion for providing cutting-edge programs that equip cybersecurity practitioners worldwide with the intel and knowledge they need to thrive and safeguard organizations against cyberthreats.

Our Values
