Atrius Health, an innovative healthcare leader, delivers an effective system of connected care for more than 690,000 adult and pediatric patients at 30 medical practice locations in eastern Massachusetts. Atrius Health’s 645 physicians and primary care providers, along with 420 additional clinicians, work in close collaboration with hospital partners, community specialists and skilled nursing facilities. Our vision is to transform care to improve lives. Atrius Health provides high-quality, patient-centered, coordinated, cost effective care to every patient we serve. By establishing a solid foundation of shared decision making, understanding and trust with each of its patients, Atrius Health enhances their health and enriches their lives. Atrius Health is part of Optum, a health services company focused on building the leading value-based care system in the country.


SUMMARY

Under general direction and as part of a high performing integrated compensation team, performs full scope of activities associated with the design, development, and administration of assigned programs. Manages projects, coordinates activities, and prepares recommendations requiring a broad and thorough understanding of provider compensation design, techniques, methods, and market practices. Serves as internal consultant to assigned functions and/or business units (service lines), providing consultative and analytic support on issues relating to a range of compensation programs and practices. Provides guidance and makes recommendations as needed. As part of the provider compensation team, ensures consistency in implementation and legal compliance of pay practices across the organization. Partners with HR, finance, and business leaders to ensure business needs and objectives are met with best-in-class compensation programs.


GENERAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

· Primary point person for assigned functions, business units (service lines) and departments. Utilizes thorough understanding of compensation models and the local and national market to guide local decision-making on full range of compensation matters.

· Participates in design, implementation, and administration of all provider compensation programs. Includes the gathering and manipulating data, calculating compensation, processing changes and payments, and reporting out to individuals and other stakeholders.

· Prepares reports and analyses, including assessments of program affordability and cost to implement. Evaluates proposals for new programs. Monitors effectiveness of on-going programs and makes recommendations for future initiatives. Ensures programs are following federal, state, and local laws.

· Maintains databases in excel and access to support provider compensation programs.

· Ensures the integrity and accuracy of data. Identifies any discrepancies in the data and if data is not being captured correctly, works with the appropriate members of IT or Business Systems Analysts to resolve the issue, and ensure that the data is accurate, and the data integrity is maintained.

· Interacts and consults with the appropriate internal and external parties to ensure an understanding of factors that affect the business data and possible sources of variation. Acts as an independent consultant, providing guidance in data analysis to members of other departments and/or senior management.

· Participates in data collection, submission, and evaluation of compensation surveys.

· Conducts market analysis for physicians and APCs using survey data and guidelines.

· Conducts assessment and review of compensation issues (e.g., salary offers for new hires, new hires, or promotions).

· Develops administrative process to support variable pay needs of specific business groups and the organization.

· Maintain databases that support provider compensation functions.


SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

· May mentor and direct the work of other compensation team members or junior analysts. basis.

EDUCATION/LICENSES/CERTIFICATIONS

BS/BA preferably in business, finance, human resource management, or data analytics (or equivalent education, training, or experience).

EXPERIENCE

Five to seven years of compensation experience including program development, design, analysis, and implementation required.

Title: Senior Analyst, Data and Analysis
Description:
Digitas is the Networked Experience Agency, built on the vision that we create magnetic experiences that earn the right for brands to exist in human networks. Today, and tomorrow. We deliver Networked Experiences by leveraging comprehensive data, technology, creative, media and strategy capabilities. Digitas delivers ambitious outcomes via unique solutions that include Creative Experiences, Integrated Media, Addressable Relationships, Social Marketing and Total Commerce. Celebrated by Ad Age as Data and Insights Agency of the Year, U.S Campaign’s Brand Experience Agency of the Year, Media Network of the Year and celebrated by Forrester and Gartner, Digitas serves the world’s leading brands through a global network comprised of more than 5,500 employees across over 65 offices in 43 countries.



Job Description



Senior Analyst, Data & Analysis

The Data & Analysis team uses data-driven insights to fuel strategic growth for clients. We believe that data should never exist in a vacuum; instead, it should be put to work to bring the best ideas and stories to our clients.

To help with this, we’re looking for an outstanding Senior Analyst – someone who can analyze massive data sets, make insightful cross-channel recommendations, and communicate strategic ideas to clients. Sound like you? Read on.

As a Senior Analyst, you’ll build the strategic and tactical foundation for data-driven marketing efforts. You’ll work to achieve client goals through brand and acquisition campaigns, site optimization, and/or online testing strategy.

Day-to-day, your role includes:

Instituting frameworks across project and campaign lifecycles, including measurement plans, primary and secondary research, and performance reporting
Diving into large data sets, uncovering insights, and providing impactful recommendations to clients
Connecting the dots across channels through data (including display media, site, search, email, and social) to provide a holistic view of marketing efforts
Communicating with clients regularly on scheduled deliverables and ad-hoc requests
Collaborating with internal teams and external partners to drive success for client’s business goals


Qualifications


3-5 years of experience in analytics or strategy
A four-year college degree
Passion for digital marketing and emerging trends in the digital landscape
Experience communicating with internal and external stakeholders at a variety of levels
Fluency with Excel (including pivot tables and vlookups) and/or other data analysis tools such as SQL or Tableau
Comfortable in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment

Got what it takes? We’d love to hear from you.



Additional Information



Digitas is an equal opportunity employer.

Show more

Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
Position Description

Position Title: Sr. Data Analyst

Location: Boston, MA

Position Overview

The Data Analyst works as part of the Data Platform Team within the Data & Analytics Group. The primary responsibilities are to analyze enterprise and vendor datasets, understand data characteristics and methodologies, and collaborate across business and technology teams to manage data onboarding and data lifecycle. The analyst will work on analyzing data profiles and data cleansing and quality check requirements, working with the dev team to build and enhance data pipelines while maintaining proper quality and control around the data sets.

Primary Responsibilities


Collaborate across teams to implement data governance policies for data ingestion and operational processes.
Manage data sets to the defined rules and controls. Develop/implement new rules and controls as needed. Remediate data issues. Address quality issues surfaced in the data set, engage vendors and stakeholders where necessary.
Define data policies and controls for new data requirements.
Analyze and document data methodologies and data feed structures related to internal and external data sources.
Provide Data Ownership and subject matter expertise for reference data and aggregate data.
Provide data quality metrics for guidance on Enterprise data sets.
Establish working relationship with key stakeholders and manage stakeholder expectations.
Provide thought leadership and participate in projects that enhance/improve data life cycles, processes, quality, and governance.
Identify and document data quality problems and opportunities to improve data quality controls via data profiling and advanced analysis.
Document, assess, influence, and synthesize business requirements to develop and advance data platform and stewardship capabilities.
Translate complex business requirements into focused technical requirements and data solutions.
Conduct detailed UAT against complex requirements and data structures. Work closely with developers to resolve issues discovered via testing and develop solutions to address logic/design deficiencies.


Key Qualifications / Skills


Extensive hands-on experience analyzing and interpreting investment data with strong knowledge of the Investment Management industry
10+ years of Investment Management experience.
Comprehensive data analysis skills with ability to detect anomalies, patterns, and data quality issues.
Strong SQL skills Experience with Snowflake is a plus.
Excellent communication skills including the ability to communicate effectively in both formal and informal contexts tailored for the audience.
Knowledge of Data Governance & Data Quality and the relevant tools.
Hands-on experience in project management
Ability to manage enterprise scale data projects.


Preferred Skills


Experience working with BI reporting tools like Tableau or Power BI is preferred.
Knowledge in coding, Python is a plus.
Familiar with agile process and JIRA
Show more

Title: HR Data Project Analyst ($22-24/hr)
Description:
HR Data Project Analyst ($22-24/hr)




We are seeking a detail-oriented HR Data Project Analyst to assist with a large HR documentation project.

We are open to recent college graduates!




What to know:

$22-24/hr. pay
Free Parking
Location is accessible by MBTA Orange Line and Bus routes




Responsibilities:

Transfer work data from SharePoint to HRIS, UKG
Ensure all HR documents are accurately uploaded into the appropriate fields within UKG
Track project progress using a self-built tracking system, preferably in Excel
Report to HR Director and assist with additional duties as needed




Qualifications:

Proficiency of Microsoft Excel, particularly using Pivot Tables
Familiarity with HR documentation (e.g., I-9, W-4, etc.)
Excellent organizational and tracking skills
Bachelor’s Degree is a plus

ProPivotal is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, color, religion, disability, veteran's status, sexual orientation, or any other protected factor.
